content.description: Another sustained climb up the steep backside.
content.location: Servant is to the left and shares it's chains, with Incredible Journey on the right.

content.description: Second route from the left, wildly overhanging start that eases in angle after the second bolt. Easy short step up to the first bolt, and watch your ass clipping the second! Crimp clipping stance. Continue past two more bolts to the anchors.
content.location: Just right of and shares chains with Beagle.

content.description: Sustained climb on the uphill side.
content.location: Just right, downhill, of Gandolf and shares chains with Something Lethal which is on the right.

content.description: Sustained climbing on the uphill side of the boulder.
content.location: Incredible Journey is to the left and Lucky Number is to the right.

content.description: A sustained climb up the arete on the corner.
content.location: Mr. Baggins is to the left and this is the last route on the uphill side.  Hoggle is to the right around the corner.

content.description: A good steep route on the back side of the boulder.  Sustained.
content.location: Downhill and to the right of Something Lethal and left of Mr. Baggins. Starts at ground level (not up on the slab/terrace area)

content.description: Crux is low between the 1st and 2nd bolt. Interesting, though large mellow jugs with long moves between. Great for the grade as you rarely find routes that are of this quality yet so steep! Too bad it is so short. Synonymous but shorter than other routes on the Tower.
content.location: Just left of American Psycho on the lower point of the boulder.  The easiest bolted route. To find it seek the route with the largest jugs near the arete that seperates the west and the south face. Just a slight left when you get to the top of the trail and you will see it right in front of your face!

content.description: Tricky start (though easier than it looks)! Head through two bolts and look for a difficult to see, but good, positive hold to clip the third. Keep trending left or you will end up on Servant of the Secret Fire (though not a bad link up). Crimpy but decent holds (crux) between the third and fourth bolts.
content.location: Just right of and shares chains with Smeagol.
First route from the left on the wall facing away from the road. All the way up the hill on the backside. Finishes on Smeagol's anchors.

content.description: This beautiful wall of overhung and pocketed rock is known as the grid wall for a reason. It's not difficult to get off route or create link ups on this one, whether on purpose or accident. Get an idea of where you are going before you start up these routes.
